<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 1"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Stonecunning](/Feats.aspx?ID=4) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Dwarf" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=54" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 36 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

</column>

---

You have a knack for noticing even small inconsistencies and craftsmanship techniques in the stonework around you. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks to notice unusual stonework. This bonus applies to checks to discover mechanical traps made of stone or hidden within stone.

 If you aren't using the [Seek](/Actions.aspx?ID=84) action or [searching](/Actions.aspx?ID=519), the GM automatically rolls a [secret](/Traits.aspx?ID=142) check for you to notice unusual stonework anyway. This check doesn't gain the circumstance bonus, and it takes a –2 circumstance penalty.
name: Stonecunning
